DOC.detailed_description: The general purpose CAre Management Effective use Opioids ( CAMEO ) study develop , test , implement novel treatment care delivery model address barrier effective pain management practicably apply VA primary care setting chronic low back pain ( CLBP ) . The CAMEO trial 2-arm randomized clinical trial compare effectiveness pharmacological vs. behavioral approach CLBP . The investigator ' study sample include 450 Veterans moderate severe CLBP despite long-term opioid therapy . Patients five primary care clinic Roudebush VA Medical Center two community base outpatient clinic recruit participate CAMEO randomize one two treatment arm . The pharmacological arm involve guideline-concordant opioid management couple algorithm-based co-analgesic treatment ( PHARM ) . Patients behavioral arm ( BEH ) receive pain self-management/coping skill training . The trial last 12-months participant undergo comprehensive outcome assessment baseline , 3 , 6 , 9 , 12 month . Study Aims : Among Veterans chronic low back pain refractory long-term opioid therapy 1 . To compare intervention ' ( PHARM vs. BEH ) effect pain intensity function 6 month ( primary end point ) 12 month ( sustained effect ) 2 .
